body:
Ok so what is the specific problem? Is there functional problem (can not read resulting data back), or visual preference (would prefer output to look different)?
And in latter case, what would be the preferred style?

Hi @cowtowncoder, I also found this behavior surprising and undesirable. I don't believe this causes any problems with correctness, it's just a style preference.

For example, say we have the following yaml:

```
foo:
  bar:
  - 1
  baz:
  - blargh:
      a: 1
```

With the current behavior of `INDENT_ARRAYS`, this would be reformatted as:

```
foo:
  bar:
   - 1
  baz:
   -
    blargh:
      a: 1
```

The desired behavior would be:

```
foo:
  bar:
    - 1
  baz:
    - blargh:
        a: 1
```

Ok that makes sense; I just want to make sure I understand the request: nothing wrong in preferences for output per se.
At this point I am open to contributions that allow defining different defaults, using SnakeYAML configuration.

issue.title: Issue #175 - implement array with indicator indentation flag

labels.name: yaml
labels.description: Issue related to YAML format backend

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-text
repository.description: Uber-project for (some) standard Jackson textual format backends: csv, properties, yaml (xml to be added in future)

body:
@dswiecki Thanks! Added one note on PR. One other thing: have I already asked for a CLA? If not, I'd need it (but just once, for the first contribution):

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson/blob/master/contributor-agreement.pdf

and the easiest way is usually to print the doc, fill & sign, scan/photo, email to `info` at fasterxml dot com.
After that we can accept any and all code contributions to all Jackson repositories.
Apologies for the hassle but this is the only piece of process we need.
Hoping to get this still in 2.12, just waiting for CLA. There is still time, earliest possible release date would be early November.

@cowtowncoder just bumped into this issue on my code too, :+1: 

But saw the CLA blocker :( what if the contributor doesn't want to (how can we unblock this) ? 

Plus, the CLA also requires personal information that many people might feel intrusive, especially when they are the ones "contributing". 

Maybe if there's some sort of automated disclaimer (first comment/description) for any new PRs submitted saying something like "By submitting your PR you hereby grant us bla bla bla"

This was just my common sense, and I might be wrong, I just saw this as an unnecessary formality we all could benefit from dropping if that was possible.
Sory for my delay, I'll try provide CLA and update PR today
I totally understand, thank you very much @cowtowncoder for your help and great efforts!
